alert.note: Alert for Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 11:24AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cass County. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 AM CDT Tuesday, a trained weather spotter reported heavy rain and ponding of water in the Brevik area due to thunderstorms. A rain gauge in Longville reported 1.42 inches of rain in the past two hours. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walker, Fifty Lakes, Wabedo, Hackensack, Longville, Leech Lake, Woman Lake, Long Lake, Wilkinson, Boy Lake, Inguadona, Ten Mile Lake, Whipholt, Webb Lake, Brevik, Pheasant Lake, Pontoria, Big Portage Lake and Lake Ada. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
